cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 50 mi (85 km) north of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving WNW across the southeastern Gulf, then turning northwest toward the Texas–Louisiana Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Texas-Louisiana border (around the Lake Charles / Cameron LA area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge and hurricane watches posted from San Luis Pass TX eastward to Ocean Springs MS, including Lake Pontchartrain and adjacent bays
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings in western Cuba and lower Florida Keys
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northwest Gulf Coast from Texas to Mississippi; inland track northward through AR/TN/KY toward the Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (Detroit not listed in NHC wind-probability table)
weather_observation.wind: Only occasional gusts below gale-force (likely <30 mph) when remnants pass well south of Detroit
weather_observation.storm_surge: None (Great Lakes port, no oceanic surge effects)
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant moisture could bring 1–2 inches of rain late Friday into Saturday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor river/stream rises possible but significant operational hazards at the port are unlikely
